assistance in living arrangements for single person - complex needs, not suitable for shared living

children.name: assistance in a shared living arrangement
assistance in living arrangements (host family/alternative family situation)
children.desc: Agreement for a participant with high support needs to stay with a host family. The host family will have minimum qualifications & provide support in the home for the agreed time. The quote will reflect the hours of assistance required & length of stay.

children.name: assistance in a shared living arrangement (hourly rate per person )
children.desc: Daily living support provided in a shared living arrangement. This rate is paid by the hour for one-to-one assistance, divided by the number of people supported.

children.name: short term accommodation and assistance
children.desc: Integrated support for self-care, accommodation, food & activities in a centre or group residence for short periods. Includes all expenses in 24 hour period with no additional loading. May be used for up to 14 consecutive days, then weekly rates apply.

assistance with the cost of preparation and delivery of meals

children.name: house and/or yard maintenance

children.desc: Assisting with, and/or supervising, personal tasks of daily life to develop skills of the participant to live as autonomously as possible.

children.name: assistance with self-care - overnight - higher intensity
children.supportCluster: Assistance with daily life at home, in the community, education and at work
children.desc: Assistance with, or supervision of, personal tasks of daily living where intensive overnight support is needed and the care giver will not have the option to sleep

children.name: assistance with self-care - night-time sleepover
children.supportCluster: Assistance with daily life at home, in the community, education and at work
children.desc: Assistance with, or supervision of, personal tasks of daily living where overnight support is needed, but the care giver can sleep when not required to provide support.

children.name: assistance with self-care - active overnight
children.supportCluster: Assistance with daily life at home, in the community, education and at work
children.desc: Assistance with, or supervision of, personal tasks of daily living where  overnight support is needed and the care giver will not have the option to sleep

children.name: overnight monitoring of self-care - off site or onsite, on call (incl 1 hr assist)
children.supportCluster: Assistance with daily life at home, in the community, education and at work
children.desc: Overnight on-call assistance with, or supervision of, personal tasks of daily living.

children.name: monitoring of self-care - off site or onsite, on call (incl 1 hr assist)
assistance from live-in carer
children.supportCluster: Assistance with daily life at home, in the community, education and at work
children.desc: A person lives in the house of, or travels with the participant and provides assistance with, and/or supervision of, personal tasks of daily life to develop skills of the participant to live as autonomously as possible.

children.name: assistance with personal domestic activities
children.supportCluster: Assistance with daily life at home, in the community, education and at work
children.desc: Assist participant to undertake and/or develop skills to maintain their home environment where the participant owns their own home & has sole or substantial responsibility for its maintenance. Includes assisting participant to do basic house & yard work.

children.name: specialised home based assistance for a child
children.supportCluster: Assistance with daily life at home, in the community, education and at work
children.desc: Specialist assistance in the home required due to additional requirements of the child’s disability; may be provided to strengthen the sustainability of informal supports.

children.name: Establishment Fee for Personal Care/Community Access
children.supportCluster: Assistance with daily life at home, in the community, education and at work
children.desc: Establishment Fee for Personal Care/Community Access (.20 hours per month).

children: Able to move around the home
Able to move with some support
Able to move with significant help
children.name: Mobility

children: Able to complete tasks with some supervision
Able to complete a couple of tasks at the time
Able to complete on task at the time
No able to complete routine tasks
children.name: Completing routine tasks

children: regular guidance and review of supports needed
Need regular assistance to ensure informal supports work
Intense assistance to ensure informal supports work
This needs an additional filtering as it only applied to "Children". The challenge is this is a reflection on the existing carers, parents and friends providing the informal support
children.name: Assist informal supports

children: Currently supported by the extended family
children.name: Independence goals
individual assessment and support by a Nurse
children.desc: Provision of care, training and supervision of a delegated worker to respond to the complex care needs of a participant where that care is not the usual responsibility of the Health System.

children: Good health can be managed easily by the use of medical aids or medications by a well trained carer
Good health can be managed easily by the use of medical aids or medications by a well trained carer with annual review by a registered nurse
Reasonable health requiring assistance the use of medical supports or medications by a well trained and monitored carer
Health status is delicate requiring regular review of the medical supports or medications by a registered nurse
Health status is highly dependant on the close monitoring of the medical aids and medication by a registered nurse
children.name: Health status

children: Living at home with no support
Living at Home with some support
children.name: Health and wellbeing
transport
children.desc: Where a participant is unable to use public transport because of their disability, transport can be funded for a taxi, carer or community transport. Owners of private vehicles (carers/individuals) can claim mileage up to $0.78/km. Other providers quote.

children.name: travel - remote
children.desc: For travel to provide supports to participants in regional and remote areas.  As approved by NDIA.

children.name: specialised transport to school/educational facility/employment/community
children.desc: Transport required to get a person with disability to school/educational facility/employment/community when they are unable to travel by other means due to their disability

children.name: Specialised and or tailored disability transport for daily life activities
Service provider / carer travel required to deliver services
assistance with accommodation and tenancy obligations
children.desc: Support is provided to guide, prompt, or undertake activities to ensure the participant obtains/retains appropriate accommodation. May include assisting to apply for a rental tenancy or to undertake tenancy obligations.

children.name: transitional support
children.supportCluster: Assistance with daily life at home, in the community, education and at work
children.desc: Transition to NDIS funding – payment of rent and utility accounts. Short term payment as per participant plan

children: Share a rented dwelling and have long term tenure
Shared dwelling but rental agreement is required
Currently unable to secure my own dwelling be it shared or alone
children.name: Housing
Transition from current funding model to NDIS

children: Happy with the current level of support
Aiming to undertake more self care and household tasks independently
Aiming to perform all daily living activities independently
Prepare for complete self management of my day to day life
Self manage my day to day life
children.name: Independence

children: Continue living with the current level of support
looking at living in my own with supervision
children.name: Living arrangement
specialised driver training
children.desc: Driving lessons required due to the impact of disability. This item should be in response to a driver trained specialist Occupational Therapist Assessment.

children.name: Driving lessons for Disability impacted person
dietician consultation and diet plan development
children.desc: Individual advice to a participant on managing diet for health and wellbeing due to the impact of their disability

children.name: dietician group session
children.desc: Group based specialist dietary advice on managing diet for wellbeing due to the impact of their disability

children.name: exercise physiology
children.desc: Individual advice to a participant regarding exercise required due to the impact of their disability

children.name: exercise physiology in a group
children.desc: advice to a participant regarding exercise required due to the impact of their disability provided in group setting

children.name: personal training
children.desc: Personal training provided to a participant required due to the impact of their disability.

children.name: assistance with decision making, daily planning, budgeting
children.desc: Provision of time limited support to assist a person to develop and maintain daily budget, including assisting in planning purchases.

children.name: coordination of supports
children.desc: Further qualifications/experience required to strengthen a higher needs participant’s ability to coordinate their supports & participate in the community. This may include resolving points of crisis, & developing resilience in the participant's network.

children.name: support connection
children.desc: Assistance to strengthen participant’s abilities to coordinate supports & participate in the community. This includes resolving points of crisis, developing capacity & resilience in a participant's network & coordinating supports from a range of sources.

children.name: Life transition planning includes mentoring, peer support and focus on individual skill development.
children.desc: Establishing volunteer assistance within the participant’s home or community to develop skills. For instance, assistance in attending appointments, shopping, bill paying, taking part in social activities and maintaining contact with others.

children.name: specialist support coordination
children.desc: Time limited support coordination, within specialist framework necessitated by high risks in participant's situation, to address barriers and reduce complexity in environment, assisting to connect with supports, build capacity and resilience.

children: Follow and change routine, pay bills, purchase food when required
Follow routine, pay bills and purchase food with some support
Able to deal with breaks in routine with household daily tasks only
Unable to deal with break in routine and no ability to plan
Making decisions and preparing household budget is not possible.
children.name: Make decisions and budgets

children: Able to plan and manage my services
Able to follow the routine of my services and make some changes
Able to follow my services routine but cannot make any changes
Able to follow directions on a day to day basis
Need full support with the planning and managing of my services
children.name: Managing services

children: you, your family and carers can develop a vision of where you want to be in the future
Need support for me, my family and carer to develop a vision of my life in the future.
children.name: Planning your life

children: Living at Home with no Support
Living at Home with some support
children.name: Independence
transition through school and to further education
children.desc: Provision of skills training, advice, assistance with arrangements, orientation to assist a person with disability moving from school to further education

children: Some need of advice & assistance required
children.name: Need for advice, assistance and training for further education
Skills development in a group
children.desc: Training for the participant in a group of 3 or more to increase their independence in daily personal activities.

children.name: Individual personal life skills development & training, includes public transport training & support
children.desc: Individual training provided in the home for general life skills to increase independence.

children.name: individual social skills development
children.desc: Social skills development with an individual, for participation in community and social activities.

children.name: training for carers/parents
children.desc: Training for carers in matters related to caring for a person with disability

children.name: training in planning and plan management
children.desc: training in planning and plan management for participants unable to do this independently but who could do all or part of the task with training.

children.name: individual skills development and training
children.desc: Individual life skills development and training including public transport training and support, developing skills for community, social and recreational participation.

children: Reasonable skills in daily act ivies and personal care
Challenged with how to apply and or use daily skills and personal care
Needs routine in the application of daily activities and personal care skills so as to be autonomous
Needs supervision to complete daily activities and/or personal care and/or transport
Unable to undertake daily activities and/or personal care and/or use of public transport
children.name: Daily activities

children: Reasonable communications skills but lack understanding of social skills
significantly challenges in communicating and socialising.
Little to know communications and social skills
children.name: Communications and Social

children: Is able to function when there is no routine
Lack of routine leads to increased frustration
Can modify the daily activities when the routine is interrupted due to a range of factors
Struggles to function when there is a lack of routine
Cannot function at all when the routine is interrupted in any way
children.name: Problem solving

children: Has numeracy, literacy and home financing skills but no plan management skills
Has numeracy, literacy but no home financing or plan management skills
Has literacy but little numeracy skills
children.name: Managing funds

children: wanting to become autonomous with personal care
Aiming to become autonomous with personal care, daily life activities
Wants to live independently with less support
children.name: Independence goal
individual counselling
children.desc: Facilitating self-knowledge, emotional acceptance and growth and the optimal development of personal resources on a one to one basis. Assist participants to work towards their personal goals and gain greater insight into their lives.

children.name: counselling group
children.desc: Facilitating self-knowledge, emotional acceptance and growth and the optimal development of personal resources through a group session. Assisting participants to gain their personal goals and gain greater insight into their lives.

children.name: Group therapy.
children.desc: Provision of interventions by more than one professional in a group session towards the participants agreed goals

children.name: therapy assistant
children.desc: Program to empower participants & improve interactions between participants & their social networks. Assistance to engage effectively in the community through a group approach to help achieve goals, gain insight into their lives & make informed decisions.

children.name: individual assessment, therapy and/or training (includes assistive technology)
children.desc: Assessment, therapy, training, fitting and any approved travel to deliver support.

children.name: multidisciplinary team
children.desc: Multidisciplinary model of support delivered to participants over 8 years to improve community outcomes for participant.

children.name: intensive behavioural intervention support
children.desc: Highly specialised intensive support interventions to address significantly harmful or persistent behaviours of concern. Development of behaviour support plans that temporarily use restrictive practices, with  intention to minimise use of these practices.

children.name: behaviour management plan, training in behaviour management strategies
children.desc: Training for carers and others in behaviour management strategies required due the persons disability.

children: Social norms are adhered to in all cases
Social norms of behaviours are not always observed when routine changes
Behaviour in the community or in the home is unpredictable
Behaviour is poor at all times
children.name: Behaviour management

children: Family/carers are able to implement and follow a behavioural intervention plan
Family/carer require some support in the implementation of the plan
Family/carer strategies to assist in the implementation and management of the plan
Family/carer require significant skills development to help implement and manage the plan
children.name: Implementing the behaviour plan

children: Want to access employment and/or education in the future
Want to access employment and/or education immediately
children.name: Employment and/or education goal

children: Aim to improve social skills to allow participation in social activities
Aim to improve social skills to allow participation in social activities
children.name: Health and wellbeing and Social goals

children: Remain in current living arrangement with the family
children.name: Living arrangement
specialised individual therapy for early childhood
children.desc: Individual specialist interventions to assist a child with disability or developmental delay and their family in home, care, community and education settings.

children.name: specialised group early childhood interventions
children.desc: Group based specialist interventions to assist a child with disability or developmental delay and their family in home, care, community and education settings. Maximum group of 4.

children.name: transdisciplinary early childhood intervention
children.desc: A coordinated & integrated program where multiple professionals share responsibility in evaluating, planning & implementing supports to improve capacity of a child with disability or developmental delay & their family. Quote based on annual amount.

children.name: Individual early childhood specialist therapy assistance and intervention
Group based early childhood specialist assistance, therapy and intervention
Family focussed training in group based multidisciplinary childhood intervention
Need for transdisciplinary team to assist with improving the capacity of disabled child and  family
assistance in specialised supported employment Level 1 DMI
children.desc: Provision of Level One ongoing on- the- job support to enable a participant to maintain/retain supported employment. Pricing guidance is weekly.

children.name: assistance in specialised supported employment Level 2 DMI
children.desc: Provision of Level Two ongoing on- the- job support to enable a participant to maintain/retain supported employment. Pricing guidance is weekly.

children.name: assistance in specialised supported employment Level 3 DMI
children.desc: Provision of Level Three ongoing on- the- job support to enable a participant to maintain/retain supported employment. Pricing guidance is weekly.

children.name: assistance in specialised supported employment Level 4 DMI
children.desc: Provision of Level Four ongoing on- the- job support to enable a participant to maintain/retain supported employment. Pricing guidance is weekly.

children.name: individual employment support
children.desc: Time limited on-the-job training & post placement support related to participant’s disability that enables them to adjust & manage demands of the job & workplace environment, & to assist employers to successfully manage the participant's placement.

children.name: employment preparation and support in a group
children.desc: In a group setting, build capacity by providing skills training such as transport, time/financial management, self-care to support a participant to get a job post school. *assumes group of 3

children.name: post school employment assistance - group support
supported employment start-up fee (ADE)
children.desc: Supported employment administrative start-up fee paid, paid once only when a Participant starts with an ADE

children.name: Employment related assessment and counselling
children.desc: Workplace assessment conducted by workplace rehabilitation provider to determine adjustments or modifications to workplace or work processes to ensure employment is maintained and matches the employees capabilities

children.name: Support in employment (ADE)
children.desc: Assistance to gain and maintain employment in ADEs, through on-the-job support, training, employer advice and assistance in transitioning from ADE. Price guidance is weekly.

children: Able to work in open employment with minimal supervision
Able to work in open employment with close supervision
Able to work in open employment with constant supervision
Able to work in specialise workplace with specific tasks
Able to work in a specialise workplace with constant supervision
children.name: Employability

community, social and recreational activities

Cannot participate in social and recreational activities without full support and structure activities
children.name: Social and recreational activities

children: Easy going, can easily join in a range of activities independently
Social behaviour or medical Needs requires an increased level of supervision to facilitate engagement in activities
Social behaviour or medical Needs requires an high level of supervision to facilitate engagement in activities
Engagement in activities required regular hands on support to assist with behavioural and/or medical issues
Cannot engage in any activities without support to assist with behaviour or medical needs at all times

children: Support needed to allow participation in OUSH care
We need to consider filtering for Teenage
children.name: After school hours care

children: Requires additional daily support to holiday
children.name: Holidaying

children: Participate in group social activity centre based
Participate in group social activity in different locations
Organise and participate in social and recreational activities independently

ramps to place wheelchair in vehicle without occupant
adaptions to control speed of car
adapted mirrors, door locks for car
vehicle adaption for wheelchair passenger
children.desc: Hoist/ lift/ramp plus restraints for wheelchair and person including floor lowering if required

children.name: adapt vehicle self driver+ wheelchair
children.desc: Remote access, basic self drive plus vehicle hoist/ lift/ramp plus restraints for wheelchair and person including floor lowering if required

children.name: adapt car self-drive electro mechanical
children.desc: Costs related to installing self-drive equipment. Includes installation automated doors, wheelchair docking, adaptions to steering, brake, gears and installation of electro mechanical controls.

children.name: car modifications - self drive from driver seat
children.desc: Includes spinners and accelerator control.

children.name: car mounted hoist for wheelchair or scooter
children.desc: Electronic or mechanical hoist mounted to car to lift wheelchair or scooter for transport.

children.name: tie downs for vehicle
children.desc: system to hold a wheelchair safely and steady whilst in transit- not for restraining the occupant

children.name: repair vehicle modification
children.desc: Repairs to specialist vehicle hoists, tie downs, driving adaptions

children.name: other innovative support
children.desc: Planner must enter description of line item into plan, and have a plan in place to evaluate success or other wise of support

children.name: Innovative Community Participation
children.desc: Mainstream services that promote inclusion of people with disability to expand opportunities for community participation and employment.
